video.title: TEDTalks: Brave Neuro World
video.synopsis: What goes on in your head? Delve into these discussions on brain development and function, including emotions, sensations, memory and illusions.

episodes.synopsis: In this emotional presentation, a neuroscientist walks you through her stroke as she witnesses her brain functions shut down one by one.
episodes.title: Jill Bolte Taylor's Stroke of Insight

episodes.synopsis: A scientist talks about the connection between cerebral tissue and the mind, using three startling delusions as examples.
episodes.title: V.S. Ramachandran on Your Mind

episodes.synopsis: A biochemist predicts an epidemic of neurological diseases as the world population ages. What's his solution?
episodes.title: Gregory Petsko on the Coming Neurological Epidemic

episodes.synopsis: Why do we like an original painting better than a forgery? Paul Bloom says it's because human beings are essentialists.
episodes.title: Paul Bloom: The Origins of Pleasure

episodes.synopsis: A neuroscientist explores perceptual illusions. Not only are we easily fooled, we kind of like it.
episodes.title: Al Seckel Says Our Brains Are Mis-wired

episodes.synopsis: Dean Ornish shows how adopting healthy lifestyle habits can affect a person at a genetic level.
episodes.title: Dean Ornish Says Your Genes Are Not Your Fate

episodes.synopsis: A neuroscientist explores the brain's ability to re-wire itself. Can we use it to enhance skills and recover lost function?
episodes.title: Michael Merzenich on Re-wiring the Brain

episodes.synopsis: Treo creator Jeff Hawkins sees the brain not as a fast processor, but as a memory system that can help us predict what will happen next.
episodes.title: Jeff Hawkins on How Brain Science Will Change Computing

episodes.synopsis: Sensing the motives and feelings of others is a natural talent for humans. But how do we do it?
episodes.title: Rebecca Saxe: How We Read Each Other's Minds

episodes.synopsis: Pawan Sinha shares research on how the brain's visual system develops, offering insights into neuroscience, engineering and even autism.
episodes.title: Pawan Sinha on How Brains Learn to See

episodes.synopsis: Elliot Krane talks about the complex mystery of chronic pain, and reviews how it works and how to treat it.
episodes.title: Elliot Krane: The Mystery of Chronic Pain

episodes.synopsis: Developmental disorders are typically diagnosed by observing behavior, but we should be looking directly at the brains of those affected.
episodes.title: Aditi Shankardass: A Second Opinion on Learning Disorders

episodes.synopsis: Neuroscientist Suzana Herculano-Houzel shares her research into the human brain: what makes it unique, how it evolved and how many neurons it has.
episodes.title: Suzana Herculano-Houzel: What Is So Special About the Human Brain?

episodes.synopsis: Neuroscientist and movement expert Daniel Wolpert presents his theory that the human brain evolved in order to control our amazing variety of motions.
episodes.title: Daniel Wolpert: The Real Reason for Brains

episodes.synopsis: Cognitive neuroscientist Sarah-Jayne Blakemore explains how teenagers' growing brains dictate their often unpredictable (and frustrating) behavior.
episodes.title: Sarah-Jayne Blakemore: The Mysterious Workings of the Adolescent Brain

episodes.synopsis: Cognitive researcher Daphne Bavelier explains how playing video games may be good for you, especially when it comes to learning and multitasking.
episodes.title: Daphne Bavelier: Your Brain on Video Games

episodes.synopsis: Philosopher John Searle discusses human consciousness, especially its complexities and the need to study it seriously as a biological phenomenon.
episodes.title: John Searle: Our Shared Condition -- Consciousness

episodes.synopsis: Neuroscientist Molly Crockett offers entertaining and informative advice about how to evaluate marketing that promises to boost your brain power.
episodes.title: Molly Crockett: Beware Neuro-bunk

episodes.synopsis: Spinal cord researcher Grégoire Courtine explains how his team used new research on traumatic spinal cord injury to enable a paralyzed rat to walk.
episodes.title: Grégoire Courtine: The Paralyzed Rat that Walked
